title: MacOS Sierra question
body:
riot support ticket guy was rude af and didnt answer my question at all

i saw there was a mini patch released and i assume that was for the mac os sierra users

any mac os sierra can confirm if the patch fixed problems on the rift itself? prior to update, i was having an issue with my logitech g900 not being able to work properly. it would jump all over the place for every mouse movement, no matter how small and had the enlarged pointer taht you get when you shake your mouse over and over again on a mac

any changes at all? is the game sitll unplayable on mac os sierra?

replies.body:
As far as I'm aware, we don't do mini patches specifically for one version of the client, though I may be wrong since I don't work on the team that deploys patches.

There have been a handful of reports regarding issues with certain gaming mice and macOS Sierra that seem to stem from some changes to how mice work in the new OS. If you intend to still use that mouse, you may need to end up installing macOS 10.11 El Capitan in order to resolve the issues you're currently having until that specific issue has been resolved.

Let me know if you have any additional questions.
When do you think you will be able to make the game up and running for sierra users? i thought maybe you guys would of fixed it on the latest patch but it doesn't seem like it.
